intro: Microstylis nemoralis, commonly known as the lesser false nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features slender, branched stems with opposite, ovate leaves that have a rough, hairy texture. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, producing a subtle, aromatic scent. Microstylis nemoralis is characterized by its unique stamen structure, with the filaments being shorter than the anthers, giving it its specific epithet.
